result.execSummary:
Alfred L Perez was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Alfred L Perez was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfred L Perez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alfred L Perez not in court.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defendant has been extradited.
State moves to dismiss.
BTC:  Dismiss.

Defendant Alfred L Perez in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Alfred L Perez in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
State of Michigan req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.

Defendant Alfred L Perez in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Alfred L Perez in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  Review hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
